page.title: 04THE RIVER STOUR
page.content: { The River Stour}flows north through our area to join the River Avon at Stratford. Some parts of Shipston-on Stour are flooded when there is a lot of rain. We asked some members of the Angling Society about the river. These{fish}are caught in the Stour: Dace,Trout,Pike,Roach,Minnow,Tench, Eel,Perch,Chub,Stickleback,Roach, Bull-head,Daddy-Ruff and Gudgeon.There are more fish in the river now than in the past.Tench and Roach are quite new to the river.The water is too shallow for Bream or Barbel. There are not many{Herons}by the river,but there are{Kingfishers}by The Mill.There are Moorhens and several types of duck,such as Mallard. { Otters}died out in the 1950s because they were hunted by otter hounds.
